content: सिध् {vI.v} {c4c} <ab>P.</ab> (सिध्यति, सिषेध, असिधत्, सेत्स्यति, सेद्धुं, सिद्ध; {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} साधयति or सेधयति; {%<ab>desid.</ab>%} सिषित्सति) {@--1@} To be accomplished or fulfilled; यत्ने कृते यदि न सिध्यति कोऽत्र दोषः <ls>H. Pr. 31</ls>; उद्यमेन हि सिध्यंति कार्याणि न मनोरथैः <ls n="H. Pr.">36</ls>; <ls>Pt. 15. 8.</ls> {@--2@} To be successful, succeed; सिध्यंति कर्मसु महत्स्वपि यन्नियोज्याः <ls>Ś. 7. 4.</ls> {@--3@} To reach, hit, fall true on; उत्कर्षः स च धन्विनां यदिषवः सिध्यंति लक्ष्ये चले <ls>Ś. 2. 5.</ls> {@--4@} To attain one's object. {@--5@} To be proved or established, to become valid; यदि वचनमावेणैवाधिपत्यं सिध्यति <ls>H. 3.</ls> {@--6@} To be settled or adjudicated. {@--7@} To be thoroughly prepared or cooked. {@--8@} To be won or conquered. <ls>Pt. 2. 36.</ls> {vII.v} {c1c} <ab>P.</ab> (सेधति, सिद्ध; the स् of सिध् is generally changed to ष् after a preposition ending in इ or उ) {@--1@} To go. {@--2@} To ward or drive off. {@--3@} To restrain, hinder, prevent. {@--4@} To interdict, prohibit. {@--5@} To ordain, command, instruct. {@--6@} To turn out well or auspiciously.
